description:
The romantic comedy centers around Asahi Kuromine, who has a crush on a cute girl named Yōko Shiragami. Shiragami just happens to be a vampire. Asahi cannot keep a secret, but he is determined to keep Shiragami's secret anyways.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: จุ๊จุ๊ จะบอกว่าฉันคือ…

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1081409840)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MARUfujiya)

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/eiji_masuda_)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1150290132)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山田隆司)

Hosei University graduate.

__[Website](https://hilcrhyme.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hilcrhyme2011)__

__Formed:__ 2006, Niigata Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Hilcrhyme is a Japanese former duo, now solo unit under record label Universal Music Artists (2019–), having previously been under Universal (2009–2017) and Jingumae Records (2018). They were affiliated with the entertainment company Naoplan Co., Ltd (2008–2017), and is currently affiliated with Universal Music Artists (2017–).

The name "Hilcrhyme" originates from a pun on the Japanese pronounciation of hillclimb and rhyme.

__Member:__
- [TOC](https://anilist.co/staff/180186) (トク) – vocalist, rapper and in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Former Member:__
- DJ KATSU (ディージェーカツ) – DJ, in-charge of composition and arrangement.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1150290132)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MARUfujiya)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1150290132)

Junko Yamanaka is a Japanese designer and animator, who does character design, animation direction, in-between, key and 2nd key animation.

After graduating from high school, she joined [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company) after working at an animation-related vocational school. After that, she left the company and became freelance.

[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mickun-blog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyake_mihimaru)
Miyake is part of the urban and pop music group Mihimaru GT

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TOC_Dress) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tocdress/)__

__TOC__ is a Japanese rapper, vocalist, lyricist and composer. He also has a solo unit named [Hilchryme](https://anilist.co/staff/180185), where he works with various creators.
